articles.title: Shapovalov downs Tsitsipas in next gen battle as ATP Cup starts
articles.description: Denis Shapovalov won the battle of the up-and-comers against Greek Stefanos Tsitsipas to clinch Canada's opening tie in the inaugural ATP Cup men's team event in Brisbane on Friday.
articles.content:
SYDNEY (Reuters) - Denis Shapovalov won the battle of the up-and-comers against Greek Stefanos Tsitsipas to clinch Canada’s opening tie in the inaugural ATP Cup men’s team event in Brisbane on Friday.

articles.title: Iran's Khamenei says anti-U.S. resistance to increase after Soleimani death: TV

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: India 2019 gold imports hits three year low as record high prices dent demand
articles.description: India's gold imports in 2019 fell 12% from a year ago to the lowest level in three years as retail buying faltered in the second half after local prices rallied to a record high, a government source said on Friday.
articles.content:
MUMBAI (Reuters) - India’s gold imports in 2019 fell 12% from a year ago to the lowest level in three years as retail buying faltered in the second half after local prices rallied to a record high, a government source said on Friday. 
Lower buying by the wor… [+446 chars]

articles.title: Exclusive: China to stick with inflation target of around 3% in 2020 - sources
articles.description: China has decided to keep its inflation target unchanged this year at around 3%, sources say, suggesting policymakers will continue to roll out economic stimulus gradually and avoid more aggressive measures.
articles.content:
BEIJING (Reuters) - China has decided to keep its inflation target unchanged this year at around 3%, sources say, suggesting policymakers will continue to roll out economic stimulus gradually and avoid more aggressive measures.

articles.title: Security camera shows Ghosn leaving Tokyo home alone before his escape - NHK
articles.description: A surveillance camera captured former Nissan Motor Co chairman Carlos Ghosn leaving his Tokyo residence alone shortly before his surprise escape from Japan, public broadcaster NHK said on Friday, citing investigative sources.

articles.title: 'They told people not to come': Australia's bushfires ravage tourism industry
articles.description: Pillars of fire and smoke from bushfires are tarnishing Australia's reputation for pristine vistas abounding in wildlife and wreaking havoc on tourism, operators say, as authorities are forced to cancel concerts, close parks and evacuate towns.

articles.description: China plans to keep its inflation target at around 3% in 2020, unchanged from last year, policy sources said, confounding speculation it might raise the bar to give it room for extra economic stimulus.

articles.author: Sachin Ravikumar
articles.title: Indian shares slip as oil jumps after U.S. air strikes in Mideast
articles.description: The Indian rupee weakened and shares slipped on Friday as oil prices surged after U.S. air strikes killed a top Iranian commander, intensifying geopolitical tensions in the Middle East.
articles.content:
BENGALURU (Reuters) - The Indian rupee weakened and shares slipped on Friday as oil prices surged after U.S. air strikes killed a top Iranian commander, intensifying geopolitical tensions in the Middle East.

articles.title: Funeral for militiamen killed in U.S. air strike to be held on Saturday: Iraqi militias
